author: Special Correspondent
text:
Students of Hindustan Institute of Technology and Science protested in front of the college at Padur, Kelambakkam, on Monday against fee hike.

The students said the institute, a unit of Hindustan University, had hiked the ‘sem carry’ fee by over Rs. 5,000. “The institute normally charges Rs. 8,000 per semester for those who have three or four arrears. We have two internal and one model exam. If we fail in one or two subjects, teachers compare our performance in the previous exams and if our performance is poor, we have to pay Rs. 8,000.

From this semester, the fee has been hiked to Rs. 13,500. We have also been asked to pay next semester’s fee by March,” a student said.
title: Hindustan institute students protest fee hike
